TouchlessCursor
MonoBehaviour
public
Ultraleap.​TouchFree.​Tooling.​Cursors.​TouchlessCursor
Ultraleap.​TouchFree.​Tooling.​Cursors.​DotCursor

This class is a base class for creating custom Touchless cursors for use with TouchFree Tooling.

Override HandleInputAction to react to InputActions as they are recieved.

For an example of a reactive cursor, see DotCursor.

Variables
cursorTransform
public RectTransform cursorTransform

The transform for the image presented by this cursor

targetPos
protected Vector2 targetPos
cursorSize
public float cursorSize

The standard size of the cursor

cursorRingThickness
public float cursorRingThickness

The thickness of the cursor ring (if it has one)

minRingThickness
public float minRingThickness

The minimum thickness the ring can be.

maxRingThickness
public float maxRingThickness

The maximum thickness the ring can be.

primaryColor
public Color primaryColor { get }
_primaryColor
[SerializeField]
protected Color _primaryColor
secondaryColor
public Color secondaryColor { get }
_secondaryColor
[SerializeField]
protected Color _secondaryColor
tertiaryColor
public Color tertiaryColor { get }
_tertiaryColor
[SerializeField]
protected Color _tertiaryColor
MonoBehaviour Overrides
Update
protected virtual void Update()

Runs on Unity's update loop to keep the attached Cursor at the position last stored in HandleInputAction

OnEnable
protected virtual void OnEnable()

Initialises & displays the cursor to its default state when the scene is fully loaded.  Also registers the Cursor for updates from the InputActionManager

OnDisable
protected virtual void OnDisable()

Deregisters the Cursor so it no longer recieves updates from the InputActionManager

Functions
HandleInputAction
protected virtual void HandleInputAction(
InputAction _inputData
)

The core of the logic for Cursors, this is invoked with each InputAction as they are recieved. Override this function to implement cursor behaviour in response.

Parameters
_inputData
InputAction

The latest input action recieved from TouchFree Service.

InitialiseCursor
protected virtual void InitialiseCursor()

Invoked when the parent GameObject is enabled.  Override this function with any intiialisation steps your cursor needs.

ShowCursor
public virtual void ShowCursor()

This ensures that all Cursors will have the ability to be shown or hidden. Be sure to override this function to cover the showing of anything an inheriting cursor uses.

HideCursor
public virtual void HideCursor()

This ensures that all Cursors will have the ability to be shown or hidden. Be sure to override this function to cover the hiding of anything an inheriting cursor uses.

SetColors
public virtual void SetColors(
Color _primary,
Color _secondary,
Color _tertiary
)

Used to change the colors of the cursor at runtime. Override it to update the specific UI elements that the colors relate to.

SetRingThickness
public virtual void SetRingThickness(
float _thickness
)

Used to set the cursorRingThickness value. Can be overridden to remap or clamp this value.  _thickness should range from 0-1 0 being the thinnest and 1 being the thickest.
